title: How to Update iOS

steps.headline:
Open {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}Settings.
steps.description: It's a gray app with gears that's typically located on your home screen.

steps.headline:
Scroll down and tap {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of an iPhone icon\n<\/p>

License: Fair Use<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} General.
Tap Software Update.
steps.description: It's at the top of the menu.

steps.headline: Tap Download and Install or Install Now.
steps.description: If a software update is already downloaded, the Install Now button will appear below the update description. You'll need to accept legal agreements before manually downloading the update.

steps.headline: Enter your passcode if prompted.
steps.description: Enter the passcode you use to unlock your phone. Your phone will restart and the update process will begin. In some cases, you may have to set up your phone again, although all your apps and data should be intact.

steps.headline: Connect your device to your computer.
steps.description: Use the USB cable that came with your device. Tap Trust on your device's screen if prompted after connecting. EXPERT TIP																															Chiara Corsaro																General Manager of macVolks, Inc.								Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area. macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN). Chiara Corsaro			General Manager of macVolks, Inc. Backup your iPhone to iTunes before downloading any major update. That way, you can revert to the previous operating system, like iOS 12, if you don't like the new operating system, like iOS 13.

steps.headline: Open iTunes.
steps.description: Do so if iTunes doesn't launch automatically when you connect your device.

steps.headline: Click on your device's icon in the top bar of the window.
steps.description: It may take a moment to appear.

steps.headline: Click on Back Up Now.
steps.description: Before updating, it's always advised to create a backup in case something goes wrong. This should only take a minute or two, and will allow you to restore your iOS device along with all your data if an error occurs during the update process. EXPERT TIP																															Chiara Corsaro																General Manager of macVolks, Inc.								Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area. macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN). Chiara Corsaro			General Manager of macVolks, Inc.				After you backup your phone to iTunes, turn iCloud back on. It's not obvious, but after backing up your iPhone to iTunes, you need to go to your phone settings, then iCloud settings, and then turn automatic iCloud backup back on. That way you have a constant backup of your phone even if you haven't done it through iTunes in a while.

steps.headline: Click on Check for Update.
steps.description: You'll see this on the Summary page after selecting your iOS device. You may be prompted to update automatically when you first launch iTunes with your device connected. You'll see a notification if your device is already up to date.

steps.headline: Click on Download and Update.
steps.description: This will download the update to your computer, and apply it to your iOS device. This process may take a while, and you can monitor the progress of the update on your device's screen.

steps.headline: Set up your device.
steps.description: After the update has been installed on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod, you'll need to complete it by entering your passcode or signing in with your Apple ID. If you installed a major update, you may be given a brief overview of the changes.

tyn: Apple device (iPhone, iPad, or iPod Touch)
text:
Performing an On-Device Update (Over-the-Air) Back up your iOS device. Open {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7e/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/7e/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of an iPhone icon.

License: Fair Use

"}Settings. It's a gray app with gears that's typically located on your home screen. Scroll down and tap {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/36/Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/36/Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of an iPhone icon

License: Fair Use

"} General. Tap Software Update. It's at the top of the menu. Tap Download and Install or Install Now. If a software update is already downloaded, the Install Now button will appear below the update description. You'll need to accept legal agreements before manually downloading the update. Enter your passcode if prompted. Enter the passcode you use to unlock your phone. Your phone will restart and the update process will begin. In some cases, you may have to set up your phone again, although all your apps and data should be intact. Using iTunes Connect your device to your computer. Use the USB cable that came with your device. Tap Trust on your device's screen if prompted after connecting. EXPERT TIP Chiara Corsaro General Manager of macVolks, Inc. Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area. macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN). Chiara Corsaro General Manager of macVolks, Inc. Backup your iPhone to iTunes before downloading any major update. That way, you can revert to the previous operating system, like iOS 12, if you don't like the new operating system, like iOS 13. Open iTunes. Do so if iTunes doesn't launch automatically when you connect your device. Click on your device's icon in the top bar of the window. It may take a moment to appear. Click on Back Up Now. Before updating, it's always advised to create a backup in case something goes wrong. This should only take a minute or two, and will allow you to restore your iOS device along with all your data if an error occurs during the update process. EXPERT TIP Chiara Corsaro General Manager of macVolks, Inc. Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area. macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN). Chiara Corsaro General Manager of macVolks, Inc. After you backup your phone to iTunes, turn iCloud back on. It's not obvious, but after backing up your iPhone to iTunes, you need to go to your phone settings, then iCloud settings, and then turn automatic iCloud backup back on. That way you have a constant backup of your phone even if you haven't done it through iTunes in a while. Click on Check for Update. You'll see this on the Summary page after selecting your iOS device. You may be prompted to update automatically when you first launch iTunes with your device connected. You'll see a notification if your device is already up to date. Click on Download and Update. This will download the update to your computer, and apply it to your iOS device. This process may take a while, and you can monitor the progress of the update on your device's screen. Set up your device. After the update has been installed on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod, you'll need to complete it by entering your passcode or signing in with your Apple ID. If you installed a major update, you may be given a brief overview of the changes.
sentences: Performing an On-Device Update (Over-the-Air) Back up your iOS device.

Open {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/7e\/Iphonesettingsappicon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}Settings.
It's a gray app with gears that's typically located on your home screen.

Scroll down and tap {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/36\/Iphonesettingsgeneralicon.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of an iPhone icon\n<\/p>

License: Fair Use<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} General.
Tap Software Update.
It's at the top of the menu.
Tap Download and Install or Install Now.
If a software update is already downloaded, the Install Now button will appear below the update description.
You'll need to accept legal agreements before manually downloading the update.
Enter your passcode if prompted.
Enter the passcode you use to unlock your phone.
Your phone will restart and the update process will begin.
In some cases, you may have to set up your phone again, although all your apps and data should be intact.
Using iTunes Connect your device to your computer.
Use the USB cable that came with your device.
Tap Trust on your device's screen if prompted after connecting.

EXPERT TIP																															Chiara Corsaro																General Manager of macVolks, Inc.								Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area.
macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN).
Chiara Corsaro			General Manager of macVolks, Inc.
Backup your iPhone to iTunes before downloading any major update.
That way, you can revert to the previous operating system, like iOS 12, if you don't like the new operating system, like iOS 13.
Open iTunes.
Do so if iTunes doesn't launch automatically when you connect your device.
Click on your device's icon in the top bar of the window.
It may take a moment to appear.
Click on Back Up Now.
Before updating, it's always advised to create a backup in case something goes wrong.
This should only take a minute or two, and will allow you to restore your iOS device along with all your data if an error occurs during the update process.

EXPERT TIP																															Chiara Corsaro																General Manager of macVolks, Inc.								Chiara Corsaro is the General Manager and Apple Certified Mac & iOS Technician for macVolks, Inc., an Apple Authorized Service Provider located in the San Francisco Bay Area.
macVolks, Inc. was founded in 1990, is accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) with an A+ rating, and is part of the Apple Consultants Network (ACN).
Chiara Corsaro			General Manager of macVolks, Inc.				After you backup your phone to iTunes, turn iCloud back on.
It's not obvious, but after backing up your iPhone to iTunes, you need to go to your phone settings, then iCloud settings, and then turn automatic iCloud backup back on.
That way you have a constant backup of your phone even if you haven't done it through iTunes in a while.
Click on Check for Update.
You'll see this on the Summary page after selecting your iOS device.
You may be prompted to update automatically when you first launch iTunes with your device connected.
You'll see a notification if your device is already up to date.
Click on Download and Update.
This will download the update to your computer, and apply it to your iOS device.
This process may take a while, and you can monitor the progress of the update on your device's screen.
Set up your device.
After the update has been installed on your iPhone, iPad, or iPod, you'll need to complete it by entering your passcode or signing in with your Apple ID.
If you installed a major update, you may be given a brief overview of the changes.
